intro: Taeniophyllum cochleare, commonly known as the spiral liverwort, is a small, terrestrial liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a distinctive, coiled appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on rocks or in damp soil. Its morphology includes a prostrate stem with closely spaced, overlapping leaves. Taeniophyllum cochleare plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
